summary: This is an email chain from August 11, 2019, regarding the forwarding of 'head count' logs, likely related to inmate monitoring. It involves communication between the Office of the Inspector General (OIG) and FBI personnel, and appears to be a response to a query about a count time, possibly in the context of Jeffrey Epstein's incarceration.

persons.name: Jogai Wirt
persons.context: Appears as the recipient of the forwarded email chain regarding requested documentation and head count logs.

persons.name: Dcarpenter
persons.context: Sent the email from the Office of the Inspector General attaching logs for 'head count' and noting it was sent from a mobile device.

connections.description: Dcarpenter from OIG forwarded documentation (head count logs) to Jogai Wirt, indicating a professional information-sharing relationship.

events.title: Request for and forwarding of head count logs
events.description: An email chain shows the Office of the Inspector General forwarding 'head count' logs to FBI personnel and Jogai Wirt in response to a request, with a prior query asking if '12:01' was the last count.

locations: 1 Battery Park Plaza, 29th floor New York NY 10004
keyFacts: The communication occurred on August 11, 2019, the day after Jeffrey Epstein's death in custody.
The subject involves 'head count' logs, which are likely related to inmate monitoring procedures.
The Office of the Inspector General (OIG) is involved in providing this documentation to FBI personnel.
The query 'Was 12:01 the last count?' suggests an investigation into the timing of inmate checks.
The document is part of the EFTA00141164 file in the Epstein case data set.
